owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setAddress(bytes32,address).details: can only be called by the addressbook owner

setController(address).details: can only be called by the addressbook owner

setLiquidationManager(address).details: can only be called by the addressbook owner

setMarginCalculator(address).details: can only be called by the addressbook owner

setMarginPool(address).details: can only be called by the addressbook owner

setOracle(address).details: can only be called by the addressbook owner

setOtokenFactory(address).details: can only be called by the addressbook owner

setOtokenImpl(address).details: can only be called by the addressbook owner

setWhitelist(address).details: can only be called by the addressbook owner

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateImpl(bytes32,address).details: function to update the implementation of a specific component of the protocol

params._id: id of the contract to be updated

AddressAdded(bytes32,address).notice: emits an event when a new address is added

ProxyCreated(bytes32,address).notice: emits an event when a new proxy is created

getAddress(bytes32).notice: return an address for specific key

setAddress(bytes32,address).notice: set a specific address for a specific key
